newsitem.title: GERMANY: E.Europe coffee market to grow in 97 - Kraft Jacobs.
newsitem.headline: E.Europe coffee market to grow in 97 - Kraft Jacobs.

text.p: Coffee sales in Poland, Hungary, and the Czech and Slovak republics may grow between three and seven percent in 1997, Kraft Jacobs Suchard AG (KJS) said in a statement received here.
Growth was seen most likely around five percent but depended on inflation, currency movements and purchasing power, it said.

Kraft Foods, the market leader in the European roast and ground coffee market reported growth rates totalling 7.5 percent this year in the four countries' sales of roast and ground coffee and put 1996 growth in soluble coffee at 17.5 percent.
It pegged its own market share in the four countries at a combined 11 percent for roasted and instant coffees.
Further plans to initiate growth included more advertising and samplings as well as boosting distribution networks, especially in rural areas, KJS said.
KJS also noted a trend towards blends with a higher arabica content in countries where spending power was improving, such as Poland.
The statement was prepared by the European division of KJS, part of U.S. Philip Morris, in response to an enquiry. --Hamburg newsroom, +49-40-41903275
